def_en: Something that is wobbly moves unsteadily from side to side.

def_cn: (尤指因为害怕、生病或筋疲力尽而)颤抖的，打战的，颤巍巍的，站不稳的
def_en: If you feel wobbly or if your legs feel wobbly, you feel weak and have difficulty standing up, especially because you are afraid, ill, or exhausted.

def_cn: (声音)发抖的，发颤的，颤抖的
def_en: If a person's voice is wobbly, it sounds weak and keeps varying in pitch, for example because the person is about to cry.

def_cn: (组织、经济或计划)不稳的，动荡的
def_en: If you describe an organization, economy, or plan as wobbly, you think it is not very good or will not be successful.
